lines.text: Love means never having to say you're sorry.
You look stupid and rich.
Well, what if I'm smart and poor?
*I'm* smart and poor.
Well what makes you so smart?
I wouldn't go out for coffee with you that's what.
Well what if I wasn't even gonna ask you to go out for coffee with me?
Well that's what makes you stupid.

See, I think you're scared. You put up a big glass wall to keep from getting hurt. But it also keeps you from getting touched. It's a risk, isn't it, Jenny? At least I had the guts to admit what I felt. Someday you're gonna have to come up with the courage to admit you care.
I care.
Amen.
It hasn't started yet.
How am I supposed to know? I've never been to a do-it-yourself wedding before.
[first lines]
What can you say about a twenty-five-year-old girl who died? That she was beautiful and brilliant? That she loved Mozart and Bach, the Beatles, and me?
If you marry her now, I'll not give you the time of day.
Father, you don't know the time of day!
[walks away]
You're gonna flunk out if you don't study.
I am studying.
Bullshit. You're looking at my legs.
You know, Jenny, you're not that great looking.
I know. But can I help it if you think so?
Jenny... I'm sorry.
Don't. Love means never having to say you're sorry.
[last lines]
Oliver, why didn't you tell me? I made a couple of calls and as soon as I found out I jumped right in the car. Oliver, I want to help.
Jenny's dead.
I'm sorry...

[cuts him off]
Love- love means never having to say you're sorry!
[walks away]
Please, Phil, about the church bit.
What?
Well, we're kind of negative on it.
I didn't necessarily mean the Catholic Church.
[to Oliver]
You know that Jennifer is Catholic? She may have told you that. And her sainted mother always dreamed of... the whole mass rigmarole, but you're... But God would bless this union in any church.
Phil?
Yeah?
About the God bit.
Yeah?
We're sort of negative about that, too.
Listen, you conceited Radcliffe bitch.
